newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Sao Paulo firms sack 10,840 workers in April.
newsitem.headline: Sao Paulo firms sack 10,840 workers in April.

text.p: Private firms in Sao Paulo state laid off 10,840 employees in April, against 10,528 workers sacked in March, Sao Paulo State Industries Federation (Fiesp) said in a statement.
Last month, 31 out of the 47 sectors included in the survey sacked personnel. Thirteen hired new people and three maintained their staff unchanged, it said.
In the last 12 months, Sao Paulo firms have sacked 127,486 workers, or 6,41 percent of Sao Paulo's industrial workforce.
So far this year, Sao Paulo industries have laid off 36,855 workers, or 1,96 percent of the Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, it added.
